title: Courage of the Colossus "abuse" is merely the symptome of a bigger issue.
body:
And that is how ridiculous damage itemization really is. 

The problem with CoTC currently is that you can go full Resolve and still output great damage because of damage items being more powerful than tank items in the end. 

Were it so that going full Resolve actually meant having to give up a lot of damage for it, we would not see CoTC being a problem. But thanks to damage itemization, it is not.

At least, that's how I see it.    ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Seems like an exaggeration as malphite would need around 557 armor (454 bonus armor) to reduce a Tristana IE crit with {{item:3036}} down to around 150 damage (though it is possible when accounting for {{item:3047}} reducing AA damage and possibly {{item:3143}} ?)

{{item:3036}} {{item:3031}} = 140 AD
Tristana level 12? = 80 AD
runes/masteries? = 15 AD
Total = 235 AD

Damage before armor 235 X 2.5 X 1.15 = 675 damage

675 X Armor damage multiplier = 150
Armor =  0.222 (78.8% damage reduction)

Malphite would need 454 bonus armor (reduced to 250 by {{item:3036}} ) and with malphite having around 103 base armor at level 14 for a total of 353 which gives around 78% damage reduction from physical damage
